Namesake:
Jack Hill Camp
Tran Hung Dao
Fate:
Transferred to South Vietnam, 13 February 1971
Escaped to the Philippines and transferred to the Philippine Navy, 5 April 1976
Name:
RVNS Tran Hung Dao (HQ-1)
RPS (later BRP) Rajah Lakandula (PF-4)
Status: Was in service in 1999 as a barracks ship, probably sold as scrap
Displacement:
1,253 long tons (1,273 t) standard
1,590 long tons (1,616 t) full load
Propulsion:
4 FM diesel engines
4 diesel-generators
6,000 shp (4.5 MW)
2 screws
Armament:
3 × single 3 in (76 mm)/50 guns
1 × twin 40 mm AA guns
8 × single 20 mm AA guns
1 × triple 21 in (533 mm) torpedo tubes
8 × depth charge projectors
1 × depth charge projector (hedgehog)
2 × depth charge tracks
